title: Explicit Rate-Optimal Streaming Codes With Smaller Field Size
abstract: Streaming codes are a class of packet-level erasure codes that ensure packet recovery over a sliding window channel which allows either a burst erasure of size <inline-formula> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">$b$ </tex-math></inline-formula> or <inline-formula> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">$a$ </tex-math></inline-formula> random erasures within any window of size <inline-formula> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">$(\tau +1)$ </tex-math></inline-formula> time units, under a strict decoding-delay constraint <inline-formula> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\tau $ </tex-math></inline-formula>. The field size over which streaming codes are constructed is an important factor in determining the implementation complexity. The best-known explicit rate-optimal streaming code, which covers all <inline-formula> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\{a,b,\tau \}$ </tex-math></inline-formula> parameter choices, requires a field size of <inline-formula> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">$q^{2}$ </tex-math></inline-formula>, where <inline-formula> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">$q \ge \tau +b-a$ </tex-math></inline-formula> is a prime power. In this work, we present an explicit rate-optimal streaming code over a field of size <inline-formula> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">$q^{2}$ </tex-math></inline-formula>, for prime power <inline-formula> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">$q \ge \tau $ </tex-math></inline-formula>. This is the smallest known field size for an explicit rate-optimal construction that takes into account all <inline-formula> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\{a,b,\tau \}$ </tex-math></inline-formula> parameters. We achieve this by modifying the non-explicit code construction due to Krishnan et al., without changing the field size. We also present a generalization of our construction, which results in streaming codes over further smaller fields by trading off code rate.
